brief_summary.textblock:
A retrospective study with the patients having a positioning consultation at hospital,
      between 2009 and 2014. In every neuromuscular disorder, the investigators describe the
      population seen in consultation, the aim of consultation, the postural problem observed in
      wheelchair, pain when sitting in wheelchair, and pressure ulcer.

clinical_study.brief_title: Wheelchair Positioning and Pain in Neuromuscular Patients
clinical_study.condition: Adult Patients With Neuromuscular Disorders Using Wheelchair

detailed_description.textblock:
Postural problem is described with MCPAA (Measure of Postural Control in Sitting Position,
      created by B. GAGNON, physiotherapist in Quebec) : we look at pelvic obliquity, pelvic
      rotation, pelvic anteversion or retroversion, trunk slope and rotation, kyphotic or
      scoliotic posture, neck posture and legs posture. We evaluate if  these deformities are
      soft, moderate or severe, and if they are relievable

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult patient with neuromuscular disorder

          -  using wheelchair

          -  Patient having a positioning consultation in GARCHES Hospital

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  refusal to participate to the protocol

          -  pregnancy

study_pop.textblock: Adults patients with neuromuscular disordres using wheelchair.

intervention.description: Assessment of pain,bedsores and  postural troubles

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Wheelchair Positioning and Pain in Adults Patients With Neuromuscular Disorder

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

collaborator.agency: Association Française contre les Myopathies (AFM), Paris

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
